text.en_US: Played the game for 10 seconds. What an incredible feat.
There used to be two of them!
A simple lunch for travels. Heals 15% of max HP.
A tad bitter but incredibly heartwarming nonetheless.
Sweet and fruity tea. Keeps you warm for a long time.
Set to be the bane of many conqueror.
An extremely rare weapon created by a paramilitary organization of unknown origin.
Once owned by a mysterious hero from a forgotten sunny land at the sea.
Once used by the careless youth to perform an "Olli".
A rough and outworn belt which belonged to a Man with resolve.
A cross-shaped weapon to fight enemies in the sky.
Once used to banish a demonic invasion.
Always sometimes protects you from Monsters.
Transforms the wearer into an extraordinary Musician.
Made for the harsh environment of the dessert.
Uses a strange whip like laser to slowly damage enemies.
A strange artifact used to banish monsters in caves.
A fashionable hat for testing. STARTER-STANDIN!
A sometimes deadly weapon for testing. STARTER-STANDIN!
A trousers-holding belt for testing. STARTER-STANDIN!
Some comfortable boots for testing. STARTER-STANDIN!
Starting Equipment. Let the Adventure begin!
Starting Equipment. Let the Adventure begin!
Starting Equipment. Let the Adventure begin!
A slightly larger version of the common Sandwich. Heals 30% of max HP.
A delicious meal for fine adventurers. Heals 50% of max HP.
All-purpose weapon made from a simple alloy of copper and tin. Just like old times.
Mass-produced, pretty sturdy and shining in the sun. A soldier's cheap bread and butter.
Goggles with frames of bronze and glasses of... glass.
Durable footwear made from durable material. Nothing special but keeps thorns out.
Typical headgear for beginners. May keep out the rain, at least.
A weak yet practical weapon for self-defense.
A simple and light protective garb for adventurers.
Light ranged weapon, ideal for warning shots and small skirmishes.
A stark reminder of a colder season yet to come.
A small bracelet to celebrate the defeat of many.
A sandwich family pack made for long journeys. Heals 80% of max HP.
Soft armor infused with the lifeforce of headstrong bovines.
Piercing weapon that is low in power but offers a surprisingly deadly potential.
Crude and cumbersome weapon for long-ranged confrontations.
Heavy boots with additional weight. Reinforces the stability of whoever wears them.
Comfortable sandals which offer little protection but grant a liberating feeling.
Symbolizes agility, surefootedness and a weakness for moving lights.
Revitalizing garment of living material. It's gnawed on one side.
Ferocious vest forged for fearless front-line fighters. Friggin' fantastic.
Cap with a simple scope attached that allows for a faster aim.
What seems like a desperate attempt at class can reveal a foe's weak spots.
Actually looks like a key, fitting into a triangle-shaped hole.
A rather odd looking key. The key bit is shaped like a triangle.
Looks like a heart. Stands for the will of an old kingdom.
Fierce horns applied to the forehead. Looks silly but no one will dare to mention it.
Keeps sweat out of the eyes and supposedly helps to concentrate.
Small, rusty blade for close quarters. Cheap, yet dangerous.
A huge radish that can be both a fearsome weapon and a healthy meal.
Weapon of choice for hoodlums with a passion for arson.
Heavy plate made from spare metal parts. Offers good protection but limits mobility.
Shaped like a bulls hooves. Infuses their wearer with obstinacy.
A rather mundane fish, commonly found in rivers. Might taste great but that's about it.
The ultimate sandwich made by a legendary cook. Heals 100% of max HP.
A well seasoned loaf for heated battles.
Bread made with zesty hot sauce.
Brings the eternal inferno right to your mouth.
Fresh wraps made with grilled tofu.
Hits your body with pure joy on every bite.
A refreshing beverage for sunny days.
Healthy salad. Does not contain any tomatoes.
An exquisite pastry topped with exotic fruits.
A cracker made of rice. It's a bit salty.
Perfect with a tiny bit of soy milk.
The classic cheese cracker. Never gets old. Never.
Best enjoyed at sunset on top of a clocktower.
Prepare for mild to severe discomfort.
A rare type of tomato salad seasoned with some ginger and salt.
Perfect to shortly keep you warm on a cold winter night.
Someone must have hit it with a blunt object at high velocity.
Pointy needles plucked from a hedgehog. Ouch! Told you so.
Actual skin from Bovines which feel almost like leather.
Nobody really knows where Meerkats get them but they sound amazing.
Useful to have when traveling the mountains and fighting snowbeasts.
Ideal for those who aspire to move at high velocities.
If you don't have one, you might get yourself killed.
Chili Con Carne in a bun. The favorite food of blue hedgehogs.
Hard to chew but contains the power of raging Bovines.
Almost tiny drill which strength depends on the willpower of the user.
Said to be able to pierce through the heaven itself.
A simple leaf commonly found in Autumn's Rise.
Eating them apparently helps to keep the doctor away for one day.
These little bugs hide on plants near rivers and only come out to search for food.
Used to grow rare plants that need pure and clean water.
A rare autumn bug who only chants his melody in bright moonlight.
These beautiful creatures sparkle azure blue at dawn until the sun sets.
Mostly obtained from traders. Contains everything from beans to sweet potatoes.
Mostly obtained from traders. Contains everything from bananas to strawberries.
Various metal parts. Might look old but could be used to create new equipment.
A rare gem which forms a strange helix spiral.
They will make you sparkle with every step. Literally.
Ideal to defend a fortified border against hostile neighbors.
A single leaf from the infamous Feather Trees only found on Bergen Trail.
Nuts and Bolts. Ancient history says they where once used as currency.
Dropped by solitary conifer trees. Could this crystal cone be a sign of their loneliness?
Falling butt first on these sure must hurt. So you better watch out!
Probably dropped here from one of the many mining shafts.
Once used as material for nobility furniture. But who wants to sit on a spiky throne?
Makes you feel incredible cool inside
This gauntlet may have seen better days but can still take and dish out a solid beating.
This long-ranged weapon is often used by soldiers at sea.
A sharp and reliable classic of warfare.
A robust tool, often used to dig through mountain and monster alike.
A shining weapon that was once even used to battle among the stars.
A headscarf drenched in cooling liquid that protects against heat and sunburns.
A headband with long, fluffy ears that resemble those of a bunny.
Very robust goggles. Frames are iron. Glasses are glass.
The ideal headgear for cold climates. Very hard to keep clean though.
High boots with spiked soles. Useful on slippery ground.
Well-crafted footgear that ensures both mobility and safe feet.
Very reliable body armor. Also the standard equipment of an elite delivery service.
Heavy plate made out of almost unbreakable rock. Emits distinctive sounds on hit.
Made from needles and bug shells to create a natural protection. Be careful in crowds!
A mysterious belt that constantly covers the owner in protective bubbles.
People often burst in sheer joy when touching this soft fur.
An incredible hard beak. It can actually be molten into a rare type of metal.
Yes, this is a bubble. It simply won't pop and some people like that.
Someone dropped this mic hard. It's shattered and unusable.
Mostly obtained from traders. Contains everything from black pepper to saffron.
It's the end. But patience will be rewarded.
Sparkling Shoes enabled! Check your item list.
Toggle to display the difference to the current equip or see the raw stats.
One or more items you need are currently equipped! Unequip and proceed with the trade?

Do you want to skip  this scene?
Select a demo mode to try out!
Press ESC or P to return to the Game

You can play CrossCode with any X-Input compatible gamepad.
What to do:
1. Connect your gamepad
2. Press any button (not the analogue sticks)
If you read 'connected' next to the gamepad symbol, your gamepad should work!
Analyze the the enemies on the field.
Browse through your items and use consumables.
Upgrade your abilities by activating nodes on the circuit boards.
Equip items to enhance your battle stats.
Check out your Status, including all Skills, Modifiers and Equipment.
Look at quests, feats, the story so far or your collection.
Take a look at your current location.
Change the options to fit your play style.
Activate previous nodes to see this one!
Sorts the list by a natural order.
Sorts the list by the item's names.
Sorts the list based on the amount of each item.
Sorts the list based on the rarity of each item.
This where you can take a look at all your collected items or set certain consumables as your favorites.
Use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] to cycle through the categories or press on the tabs if you use the mouse.
The first tab shows the last items you have collect to keep an eye on all your loot!
Pressing \i[help3] opens the sort menu. You can choose between 4 types of sorting:
--\c[3]Auto\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by a natural order.
--\c[3]Name\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the name of the items.
--\c[3]Amount\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the amount of each item you have. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same amount.
--\c[3]Rarity\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the rarity of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same rarity.

Most consumables are \c[3]buffs used to aid you in battle\c[0]. Hovering over an consumable that is also a buff shows a little interface telling you what the items does in the \c[3]bottom left corner\c[0].
The symbols you see tell you what stat or modifier changes and how strong the stat is increased. Scroll right to get a list describing each symbol.
--\i[stat-rank-1]:-- Marks a slight increase in the given stat or modifier.
--\i[stat-rank-2]:-- Marks a medium increase in the given stat or modifier.
--\i[stat-rank-3]:-- Marks a large increase in the given stat or modifier.
--\i[stat-heat]:-- Increases resistance against the heat element.
--\i[stat-cold]:-- Increases resistance against the cold element.
--\i[stat-shock]:-- Increases resistance against the shock element.
--\i[stat-wave]:-- Increases resistance against the wave element.
Hover over an item in the Consumables Section and press \i[help2] to add it as a favorite
In this menu you can equip your collected gear into 5 different slots.
Select a body part by clicking on one of the buttons. You can also use the mouse to click on the buttons in the center.
Additionally you can cycle through the body parts using \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] or \i[left] and \i[right].
Pressing \i[help3] opens the sort menu. You can choose between 4 types of sorting:
--\c[3]Auto\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by a natural order.
--\c[3]Name\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the name of the items.
--\c[3]Amount\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the amount of each item you have. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same amount.
--\c[3]Rarity\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the rarity of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same rarity.

Hovering over a piece of equipment shows the changes on your \c[3]status parameters\c[0] on the left side of the screen. Having already equipped an item will show how your parameters change when switching to another piece of gear.
\c[3]Modifiers\c[0] are shown below the status parameters. Scroll right to get list of the effects each modifier can have.
--\c[3]XP Zero\c[0]: Don't gain any experience by defeating enemies.
--\c[3]XP Plus\c[0]: Increased the amount of experience you get from defeating enemies.
--\c[3]Lucky Lucky\c[0]: Increases the chance to get items from enemies.
--\c[3]Scope\c[0]: Increases the speed of getting precise aiming.
--\c[3]Speed Shot\c[0]: Increases the damage of fast balls.
--\c[3]Power Shot\c[0]: Increases the damage of charged balls.
--\c[3]Melee Damage\c[0]: Increases the damage of melee attacks.
--\c[3]Critical Damage\c[0]: Increases the damage of critical attacks.
--\c[3]Flash Step\c[0]: Increase the time of invincibility when dashing.
--\c[3]Iron Stance\c[0]: Increase your knockback resistance to weak attacks, depending on MaxHP.
--\c[3]HP Regen\c[0]: Activates HP regeneration while in combat, depending on MaxHP.
In this menu you can spend your collected \c[3]Cross Points (CP)\c[0] to unlock skills on the skill trees.
For this demo you can only select the neutral skill tree in the center of the screen. The final version will feature a tree for each element.
Scroll right to get more info on the detailed view that appears once you press on one of the trees.
Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] or drag the mouse to move around the skill tree.
With the gamepad you can use \i[left-stick] to move the cursor around and \i[right-stick] to just move the camera.
Hover over a skill to see what it does and how many CP you need to activate it.
Note that in order to activate a skill you must first unlock its parent.
Notice the branches on some paths along the skill tree? Those always offer 2 ways and you can only walk on one of them.
However you can \c[3]switch between both paths at any time without spending any additional points\c[0] as long as you have a skill activated on one of the branch paths.
By pressing \i[help2] you can enter a special swap mode in the overview where you can quickly swap branches. Just select a panel and press it to swap the skills!
The aforementioned branches always contain at least one \c[3]Combat Art\c[0] on each way, which you can recognize by their \c[3]light-grey background\c[0].
Those Combat Arts are skills that don't increase your parameters but instead allow you to perform special abilities during combat, in exchange for \c[3]Special Points (SP)\c[0].
Combat Arts can greatly increase your chances in battle, so it is advised that you learn at least one of them as quickly as possible!
Here you can check out your current position in the area and see how many treasures you have found.
Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] to move the camera or drag with the mouse. You can also use \i[left-stick] or \i[right-stick] with the gamepad.
Pressing \i[help2] centers the current floor. If Lea is on the currently active floor it will center on the room she is currently in.
In this menu you can change various settings to customize your game experience. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
Some options might require a restart. Options like these are \c[3]marked with a red information text.\c[0]
Options are saved as soon as you leave the main menu.
Use \i[help2] to reset all settings back to default. This will also reset all your key bindings.
In this menu you can buy consumables or equipment.
Note that you need to have sufficient funds to buy an item!
Fire a powerful projectile that will fly through enemies.
Fire a mass of small shots in a narrow angle.
A wide-ranged spinning move hitting many nearby enemies.
Catch your enemies in a spinning saw. Powerful attack with smaller range.
Blast away all nearby enemies, freeing up space.
Creates a damage-reducing shield, lasting for a couple of seconds.
Dash right through your enemies, damaging everything in your way.
A very powerful attack that will hit exactly one enemy.

The Skill tree structure has changed, so we had to reset your skill configuration. Sorry! You can reassign your skills again.
I always wonder what it stands for.
It's probably for an event the game mods haven't announced yet.
Apparently some hacker hid items in this area.
So everyone is looking for them right now.
You must be girl they told me about!
Yeah, so the developers asked me to help you to get around.
The areas get quite big and since the \c[3]teleport feature\c[0] isn't done yet they thought you could use someone for that.
So \c[3]whenever you find me somewhere I unlock the position as a teleport target\c[0]. Sounds good?
Great! By the by, you can unlock teleport positions by just visiting maps or finding certain spots.
Alright, see just hit me up if you changed you mind.
Time to meet our pet again!
This time, we prepared a stage for you.
We took the liberty to change it.
Now show us your best performance!

text.en_US: I came to see this darn old excuse for an observatory.
To think of what has become of this place...
Ye see, in my time this place had a some nasty foes in it.
'Tis was a good place for a good brawl.
There is a note on the door however.
"I took the key and broke it into 2 pieces. I hid them in this area. You can try to find them, but I'm sure you never will!"
Seems like some bugger had fun here.
What a preposterous reason for a quest...
Well, I guess the solution is simple.
Ye lass go and find me the pieces.
I'm no avatar so I can't see those darn chests. But you can.
Ah, this is what I like to see.
Wait...\! You already have to them?
Ye makin an old man proud, lass.
Ye talk to me as soon as you ready to try this out.
Talk to me again if ye found all the pieces.
Ye found all those darn pieces?
Ye makin an old man proud, lass.
Ye talk to me as soon as you ready to try this out.
Ah, don't worry. I'm sure ye find them sooner or later.
Now let's see if this works.
Glad to see this's not some lazy prank.
Alright. Ye go ahead and see if there still foes to find in there.
It's alright. Not like I can do much damage to them.
Ye go on ahead and see if there still foes to find in there.
Looks like you helped the captain to finally open that strange building.
Oh, you're that girl from the cargo ship?
The captain got some weird call from the developers. He's over there.
Why don't you pay him a visit?
This old geezer simply won't go away...
Amazing. Now he stole the quest...
Don't tell me you finished the quest?
Really? I was waiting all day for a chance.
I didn't mention it before but you can also reset your skill tree here or check your stats.
Oh, it's just a little thing the developers thought to be helpful.
You can basically take a look at \c[3]your progress\c[0] in this area.
Or \c[3]reset your skills\c[0]... for a price that is!
Speaking of money, I also set up a little \c[3]shop\c[0] if you are interested in the tasty stuff.
What can I hook you up with?
You sure you wanna reset all your skills?
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
So, you met the other ones huh?
You don't want to run back here every time to see your stats, right?
Wanna take a look at the stats screen, reset your skills or shop a little?
You sure you wanna reset all your skills?
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
Ye just go into that big room to start the fight.
I will save the time ye take for it.
Ye just go into that big room to start the fight.
I will save the time ye take for it.
Ye back for another try or to see your best time?
Ye just go into the big room lass. I'll save the time for ye.
Ye wanna take a look at your best times?
Alright. Ye come back later then. The challenge takes a some time to be ready again.
Still big room inside a darn small building.
Them developers sure know to make it look plausible.
Well, the counter is still there. So I guess you can take on the challenge.
Ye want to try it out?
But ye better make sure ye're up to the task.
The challenge here is pretty darn tough.
He, can't stop the lass from a fight.
Ye just go into that big room to start the battle.
I will save the time ye need for it.

desc: EventTrigger fight-start - The Mice START IF tmp.startFight

text.en_US: Ye did it! Very good performance, lass.
As promised I saved your time. So ye' just talk to me to get an overview.
However the challenge will need some time to be ready again.
A Spheromancer? Not something I see often these days.
You see the class is very hard to master so it became a bit unpopular I would say.
So today, you find only a handful of people trying to play this class.
Ah, it's Ms Avatar again!\. So great to see you in CrossWorlds.
Isn't it just AWESOME here?\. Man, I can't wait to play it myself one day!
Anyway, I'm not just here for the funzies.\. The cap' gave me the important task to help you with your equipment.
Sadly, we can't just give you the stuff.\. There's rules y'know?
Don't worry, we'll just turn it into a reward for a simple quest.
Defeat \v[temp.kills] enemies in this area and come back for your reward.
Wait a second, my data shows that you've already defeated enough enemies.\. Amazing!
Here's the equipment I promised.\. Low-grade stuff but it'll help you, I'm sure.
With that done, I'll take a nice CrossWorlds vacation.\. See you around, Ms Avatar!
Alright, you already got \v[stats.enemyKills] kills so you still need \v[temp.kills] more.
Alright, you got no kills so far, meaning you still need to defeat \v[temp.kills] enemies.
Happy hunting!\. Show me some awesome VRP fighting!
Hello Ms Avatar!\. Enjoying the game?
Of course you do!\. Man, I wish I had a VRP-device to go with my glasses.
Oh well, back to work.\. Lemme just check your stats\..\..\..
According to my data you got enough kills to complete the quest.\. Great!
Here's the equipment I promised.\. Low-grade stuff but it'll help you, I'm sure.
With that done, I'll take a nice CrossWorlds vacation.\. See you around, Ms Avatar!
Alright, you already got \v[stats.enemyKills] kills so you still need \v[temp.kills] more.
Alright, you got no kills so far, meaning you still need to defeat \v[temp.kills] enemies.
Happy hunting!\. Show me some awesome VRP fighting!
Sorry Ms Avatar, I'm on vacation now.\. Everything's so amazing!

\i[arrow-nw] To Bergen Trail.
\i[arrow-sw] Ye old Observatory
Yarr, I might be a man of the sea, but rivers like this one have them own beauty.
I tell ye, them fishes are biting like mad.\. Like them never saw a proper fisherman before!
Know what? Ye look like ye could use a bit o' meat on yer, so take some!
Don't ye eat them all at once!
Yarr, I could build me a boat and travel the river.
You must be girl they told me about!
Yeah, so the developers asked me to help you to get around.
The areas get quite big and since the \c[3]teleport feature\c[0] isn't done yet they thought you could use someone for that.
So \c[3]whenever you find me somewhere I unlock the position as a teleport target\c[0]. Sounds good?
Great! Just talk to me again if you want to be teleported!
Alright, just hit me up if you changed your mind.
Did you notice how they removed the meeting place here?
Yeah, Patch notes said it's for some bigger update soon.
Are you...\. a new player, too?
Great! ...\. I mean uh...\. Could you help me with something?
See...\. I need new equipment...\. An \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0].
I heard they offer it in the armory of R-\.\c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0]...\.once you reach this place.
I'd buy it myself...\. but...\. see...
I hate this town!\. It's so crowded!\. So many people, signs and noises!\. I-\.I can't take it...
So uh...\. Could you please buy some \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0] for me at Rookie Harbor?
O-\.Of course I'll pay you back...\. So...\. uhm...\. pretty please?
...Oh!\. I-\.Is that the \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0] you bought for me?
Here I'll pay you back the price!\. P-\.Plus some extra!
A-\.And also some items I found in Bergen Trail!\. It's not much, but maybe you can use it...
I g-\.gotta go now!\. Thanks again!
P-\.Please buy me that \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0] from the armory in Rookie Harbor.
They should offer it n-\.now that you've reached Bergen Trail.

\i[arrow-w] The Rocky Climb
\i[arrow-s] Base of the Mountain 
\i[arrow-ne] Old Crater

\i[arrow-n] Bergen
\i[arrow-se] Base of the Mountain 
\i[arrow-sw] Off Road
You did it.\. Yay and stuff.
What a convenient stage we got here!
Now, it is time to face your trial!
Let us see if you are the genuine article!
A display of your talents shall suffice as proof!
I am just as confused about this whole situation as you are...
It is certainly a mess, but we will get you out of this.
For now, take on this challenge and keep him busy.
I know, this enemy looks intimidating, but do not lose hope!
I am confident you will be able to handle this!
... Because I can see it's battle stats.\. They match your level!
Cap, I'm back with the report!
Here's the avatar - Lea, she's called.
Aye... hard to miss that lass.\. Hope ye didn't run into everything with those horns there.
Wait...\. don't ya tell me you didn't notice the horns 'til now, Lea...
Anyway, make sure ye'll clean up the mess ye started down in the cargo hold soon.
I hope Sergey is satisfied.\. Is he around?
Yeah, just let me setup your headset for a sec.
My good man! Has been a long time.
Indeed.\. You are still clinging to that jet pack, I see?
Ye know I'd never travel the sea without good ol' Betty.
Anyway, I hope ye two will be ready to travel on soon.
An avatar on board just calls for darn trouble.
Of course.\. We will make this as brief as possible.
Gee, Cap.\. What kinda welcome is that s'posed to be?
Also, ain't we talkin' to Jet, former VRP-Dueling-Champ?
You keep telling us about all your combat moves from the old days.
So here I thought maybe you'd want to give Lea a small combat lesson?
Ye're tellin' me that little lass is up for a battle?
Right, we'll see about that.\. Ye just talk to me later the day.
Ye can show the lass around the ship, but don't ye stir up any trouble.
C'mon, Lea!\. It's time for some fresh air!
This is no place for ye, lass.\. Go play somewhere else.
There ye are.\. It's pretty darn time for your combat lesson.
Good.\. Let's go to the balcony.
Do ye still need to prepare yourself?\. I don't got all day, lass.

Is that blue guy still out there?\.
Seriously, we never had anything happening like that before.
You'd think they make sure player don't escape the playground or something.
Girl! Skip the chatting, will you? We have to hurry!
Are you looking for the Captain?
I think he's currently somewhere in the cabins.
Indeed, even a captain needs a break once in a while...

You are that Avatar girl we were warned about, right?\.
Sorry, but I need to pay attention to the radar.

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: It's still on the radar, approaching us at high velocity

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: No transmission, no darn ship to see.\. What is going on here?

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: Captain! I think I caught it on satellite! You gotta see this!
...Whoa!\. You speak!\. Is your voice finally back?
Her speech synchronization is still malfunctioning.
I just hard coded the word "Hi" into her speech module.
That's all she can say for now.\. I'm currently working on adding more words.
I see... It's a beginning, I s'pose.
Anyway, Cap and I here have been planning out your combat training, girl.
We're almost set and good to go, right?
Aye, this is gonna be interestin'.
So, I'll be off to my cabin for some last preparations.
I'll be done in no time, so just stick with the captain 'kay?
Aye, I'll be back at the bridge. Ye can talk to me when ye're ready for the lesson.
Make sure ye're prepared.\. I'll be askin' for your full attention.
Make sure ye clean up the kitchen after ye're done cookin', understood?
It's not like we forgot since the last time he told us.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF lore.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US:
Oh Well...\.
Look at this mess.\. The Captain will surely not like this.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF lore.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200
EventTrigger messy START IF lore.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200
EventTrigger messy START IF lore.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US: Jet has a strict order around the ship.\. Every room needs to be cleaned before work.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF lore.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US: I wonder how these guys managed to skip Jet's daily control visit.
Oh! I thought they canceled this game!

He seems pretty into the game.\.
We better let him play...
Oh!\. You must be the avatar the captain told us about.
Well, feel free to check out the ship.
It's just one of the small ships of the Solar class but it does its job.
But I suggest you don't go near the room across...
So you checked out the room across?
Don't mind it.\. Normally every room has to be clean.
But somehow she manages to get around captain Jet's control tours.
Hey there, Lea.\. You better not let the Captain waiting.
Wait Carla... is this you room?
Sure is.\. Something wrong with it?
I mean, how did Jet not see this... \! room?
Well, you'll have to wait for another time for my secrets I guess.
I'm sure the cap wants to start teaching Lea some new tricks.
Well, I guess we go then...
Hey there, Lea.\. You better not let the Captain waiting.

desc: EventTrigger messy end? START IF lore.carla.messy.start2 && lore.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF lore.carla.messy.start2 && lore.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF lore.carla.messy.start2 && lore.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF lore.carla.messy.start2 && lore.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF lore.carla.messy.start2 && lore.carla.messy.progress >= 10

text.en_US: I will find it out someday.

desc: EventTrigger messy end? START IF lore.carla.messy.start2 && lore.carla.messy.progress >= 10

text.en_US: THE TIME FOR REVENGE IS NIGH!

Awesome! You mastered the final challenge! 
This is all for now. 
Thanks for playing!

desc: EventTrigger enterRoom2 START IF map.entered || true

text.en_US: Get ready for the final challenge!

Thanks a lot for completing this tech demo of CrossCode!
If you like what you saw, please tell your friends!
We'd like to get word around! :D
Also, follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

Wait, we're not done yet!
From here on we have a small challenge for you to master, if you like to bash some more enemies. 
Have fun!
Lea, you don't open presents like this!
Come on, Ms. Avatar!\. There are still some boxes left.
Come on, Ms. Avatar! There are still some boxes left.
I got a friend back home who's a regular CrossWorlds player.
I seriously envy him!\. I didn't use to have the money for the game and now... well... I'm on a ship.
But at least now I can claim to have seen a life avatar in person!
Maybe some day I'll be finally be able to play CrossWorlds as well.\. And then, who knows, we might just meet again!
Dear me, I never knew my colleague was such a geek.
The whole day he's been blabbing about CrossWorlds and Avatars and what not.
Well, admittedly CrossWorlds is pretty amazing.
I still find it hard to believe they managed to get all the resources to essentially turn this moon into high-technology theme-park.
... I suppose it's a good thing they did!\. It's one steady income for me, being a small cog in this machine.
And she's a Spheromancer class!\. How awesome is that?
That gotta be your first fan, Lea.
Hey there, Carla. Good to see you.\. About all these strange boxes here...
Yeah... I know.\. I'm supposed to clean that up.
But right now I have to take care of the avatar, y'know?
I'll do it later today, okay?\. See ya later!
She said exactly the same thing yesterday.
Anyway, Carla just passed by us again.
She told us, that you could take care of all these boxes here.
I mean, really, can you believe this woman?\. Now she's loading off her work on our guests.
It's easy to destroy these boxes with your avatar weapons, right?
Awesome!\. Please, I wanna see that!
Well...\. no pressure, you know.\. You are our guest after all.\. But you'd help us out a lot.
So, will you destroy the boxes for us?
Destroy all boxes in this room.
I'm really surprised how quickly those balls were flying.
What are you even talking about?
I didn't see any balls.\. Only those boxes disappearing for whatever reason.
Yeah, you need to wear these AR goggles to see them.
The balls and their impact are all like... virtual and stuff.
I see... so that's why you have been wearing these goofy glasses all the time.
Goofy? You know nothing about style, Lady!
Anyway, thanks a lot for the help.
Yes!\. Thank you so much, Ms. Avatar!

Thanks a lot for completing this tech demo of CrossCode!
If you like what you saw, please tell your friends!
We'd like to get word around! :D
Also, follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

Wait, we're not done yet!
From here on we have a small challenge for you to master, if you like to bash some more enemies. 
Have fun!
Oh yeah, Lea?\. Just a heads up - don't worry about the captain being a bit on the grumpy side.
That's just the way he is.
Well, well... Our endeavour has not been concluded!
You will not escape our will!
Lea, those are high level opponents.
Don't fight them and run to the teleporter!
Girl, you sure are a natural with that ball thing!
Carla, they are called VRP.\. Not "balls".
Ah, c'mon! Nobody calls them like that anymore, y'know?
Well done!\. Yeah that was all.\. It's a small room.
What are ya standing around here?\. The wall is removed, the path is clear.
Well something is different about this switch, right?
I'm afraid one ball just won't cut it.
Now, several balls on the other hand...
Nah, I won't give ya a hint for that, girl.
You removed the wall, the rest is straightforward.
Oh yeah, that one is kinda mean.\. Need a hint?
Did you try to hit this switch with charged balls?
You probably realize that doesn't work.\. It's too slow.
How about you look around?\. There might be another way.
Heh, this is so much fun.\. Just too bad we can't chat along the way...
Ah, don't worry!\. I'm sure Sergey will get the speech problem fixed in no time.
It is...\. challenging to say the least.
Please, a bit of optimism, sir...
Entering the next stage, more switches await!

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Oh yeah!\. Never mind the visor!\. I just need those to see what you're doing.
Don't worry about it for now.\. We'll explain it to you later on.
Huh? Don't tell me you're already stuck?
Look, how about you try to jump over this container here?
That cardboard box ain't there for no reason
Walk toward small object to auto-jump on top of them.
So, that wall ain't anymore. You're free to pass.
Now all that's left is some jumping over those containers.
Move toward edges to auto-jump over gaps.
You need to find a way to remove this wall.
Basic stuff Lea. You'll need to throw balls at something.\. That's all I'm gonna say.
Y'know, ball throwing is pretty much the solution to most obstacles around here.
Those boxes here are no exception.
Well, ain't that just another stupid wall....
But the color is different this time. Maybe that means something, who knows?
I'm pretty sure you yourself can't pass it.\. But maybe something else can...?
Well, won't ya look at all those switches! Need a hint?
Yeah, that switch is pretty well hidden, huh?
Remember those charged balls?\. Those bouncing on walls, y'know?
I'm sure those will help ya out here.
See those switches on the containers? Yes, you can hit those. From a distance, that is!
Just make sure you throw the balls from the same height.
Really?\. You can't figure this one out?
Just jump over the boxes and hit that thing hard.\. That's all, really.
Right, then! Go on! You're almost there!
That's all for this room!\. Nice work, girl!
Your task is to reach the door at the other end of this room.
And don't mind me! I'll just stick along and keep an eye on ya.
Well... I might give you some hints. If you ask nicely, y'know?

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!

desc: EventTrigger ShreddersGo START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.shreddersStart && !map.shreddersSpawned

text.en_US: Damn, how we're gonna pass this one?!

desc: EventTrigger ShreddersGo START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.shreddersStart && !map.shreddersSpawned
EventTrigger Carla does Stuff START IF map.carlaDoesStuff

text.en_US: Carla, Instant Matter builder, at your service.
Welcome to rat's fortress, standing unpenetrated for centuries!
Apparently, somebody had a fun time putting this together.
Just hit 'em with those balls. That's all there is to it.
Yeah, you're probably missing the mouse robots here.
These things are pretty small, y'know?\. Might be they're hidden somewhere...
Ain't no way getting close to those mouse robots in that corner.
But you can still hit them, y'know? Remember the red walls? Balls flying through them and all?
Girl, that was so quick!\. Took me forever to put all of this together.
Ha, finally!\. This one's my favorite!
Here you can go wild on these mouse robots!
It's a moving target practice!\. Have fun, girl!
Press \i[key-throw] repeatedly to hold down the enemies in a rapid fire.
Hold \i[gamepad-throw] to hold down the enemies in a rapid fire.

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!

desc: EventTrigger CarlaCheat START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.carlaCheat
EventTrigger CarlaCheat START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.carlaCheat

text.en_US: Time for turrets!\. Don't worry, those things won't hurt you.
This is in fact just a simple puzzle.
C'mon, you can do this yourself.\. Really want a hint?
Oh well.\. Look, these blocks are kinda like switches.
Only they don't react to the typical balls.
Maybe they react when hit by something else.
Attagirl! Use that pretty head of yours.
Hm, this one is a tiny bit more tricky. Need some help?
To make the turret hit these blocks you have to stand between turret and block.
Then you need to dodge the bullet right after it was shot.
You need to get the timing right.\. C'mon, I know you can do it!
It's actually almost the same as before.\. Only this time the turret and blocks are on a higher level.
So get up on that container in the middle and dodge some bullets!
These things are kinda unexpected, right?\. Need a hint?
That mirror-like thing only shoots bullets, when it's hit by your balls.
And it always shoots the bullets right at you.
You'll need a block between you and the mirror and still need to hit the mirror with one of your balls...
So here's the hint:\. Think bouncing balls!
Phew, that's all for this room.\. Lot's of puzzles, right?\. But don't worry, you will get some real action in the next room!
A bit of advice!\. Hit them with \i[tech]charged balls to cancel their attacks!
Enter that arena there to start the lil' sparring session.
If you liked this room, ya gonna love the next one, trust me!
Yes!!\. That was awesome, girl!\. Sergey, you were not kidding! She really got a hang for battles.
Yeah, that sure takes me back.
Just a short warning.\. Here you'll meet your first "real" enemies.
And by "real" I mean those things will in fact attack you.
Don't ya get me wrong!\. Those enemies are really easy, but still....
If you manage to get beat down, your respawn point is right in this room.
Uhm...\. that means there is no real danger!\. Go ahead and kick some ass!
Ah, just a moment!\. Let me enable the dash module before we start the battle.
Dash is essential in battle, since it helps you to quickly dodge enemy attack at any time.
Right he is!\. Now please enter to the right in order to proceed with the ass kicking.
Press \i[dash] while moving to dash, though only up to 3 times in a row. You can dash at any time, even while aiming.

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Amazing work!\. Numbers sure can't beat skill.
Wouldn't ya look at all those cowards ganging up on you!
But don't panic,\. just keep moving and strike fast!
Aaand another victory for our fearless gladiator Lea!\.
C'mon show me a right hook! \.\. And a left!
Standard VPI wasn't modelled after boxing\..\..\..
Nice moves!\. They didn't even see it coming.
Yeah yeah I know,\. a second waited is an attack wasted.
Still,\. you should know that your strikes have enough punch to interrupt some hostile attacks.
So you can just pummel your opponents without giving them a chance to strike back.
Sounds like a plan, am I right?\. So go get 'em!
Close in fast and whack 'em over the head!

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Hey champ, get your adrenaline down again for a second.
We gotta add a bit more edge to your arsenal.\.\. A sharp one that is!
I see we got your attention.\.\. Sergey, you finished?
Yes.\.\.\. Unlocking Virtual Proximity Impact\..\..\..\. now.
...you can quickly tear through several targets in your path at once.
Only them close ones,\.of course.\. You got that?
Sharp as a blade!\. Now start by clearing that path for us, will ya?
Click \i[key-throw] near Lea inside the circle to perform a close-combat attack.
Press \i[gamepad-throw] without touching \i[right-stick] to perform a close-combat attack.
Just do a few warm-up swings on those pesky obstacles.
Just do a few warm-up swings on those pesky obstacles.
Don't worry, those are the same weaklings as before.
More punching bags await your blade.
And here we are at the last challenge.
Don't let the big number scare you and keep concentrated.
That was quite the ride, huh?
Aaand you just crossed the finish line!\. Congratz!
It's like you've never forgotten the basics at all.
Oh my, you still look so puzzled about all this.
I suppose it is about time we explain all the circumstances.
You bet it is.\. But let's take a short break before that, okay?
I still need to report to the captain.\. He wants to meet Lea as well.
Good idea.\. Better not to keep Jet waiting for too long.

desc: EventTrigger DesignerWarning START IF plot.line>= 700 && tmp.designerSay

text.en_US: We can sense your fear...\. your every step!

desc: EventTrigger DesignerAgain START IF tmp.designerAgain && map.shredder1

text.en_US: Welcome on board of the M.S. Solar!
Y'know, the view here is nice, but you gotta see what's beyond the bow.
We're currently steering towards Rhombus Square. That's something to look at!
Actually, why don't we just go to the bow and explain Lea the situation?
Seeing Rhombus Square will make it easier for her to understand, correct?
S...\. Sorry, I'm busy checking the containers here.
Hello there! You must be a guest on this ship, right?
Why, don't be shy! We seamen may look rough, but we're easy going folks, really.
You want to know what I'm doing here?
I'm currently checking up on the solar panels here.
These are our primary energy source, so they better work properly!
Otherwise our nice and shiny M.S. Solar won't budge a centimeter.
Trust me, being stuck in the ocean too long is not something you want to experience.
Just let me do my work, okay?
Huh... I suppose this guy did not even notice you are an avatar.
Well, the human appearance is pretty convincing.
You don't look like a proper seaman. So, I reckon you're a guest?
Not very talkative, huh? Sorry, I'm in the middle of a maintenance routine.
Ah, look who's there.\. You must be that avatar, right?
Well then, welcome to the M.S. Solar!
If you lean over the railing a bit you might even see the name of the ship.
Oi, make sure you don't fall into the sea.\. I'm pretty sure avatars are bad at swimming.
I have no idea what is going on, but you better listen to the Cap' and get going!
Hey, can't you see I'm busy here?\. ... Wait, who are you?
Oh right, I remember now.\. You are that pseudo robot thing.
Oh, no offense.\. You see, I just recently had this discussion with a colleague.
It was about avatar being the same as robots.
And I have to insist they are not!\. Avatar are just some fragile, temporary collection of instant matter.
Everybody knows real robots are made of metal.\. Like those beauties here.
So I just can't share the excitement of my colleagues about your presence.
You're just an avatar.\. No true robot, see?
Anyway, I have to take care of my babies here.\. So if you'd excuse me...
Oh my!\. That's some extremely colored hair you got there.
I've already heard that avatar designs tend to be flamboyant, but... really?
You're not happy about them either, huh?
Now I have to wonder who put those things onto you.
I expected the embodiment of some gamer kiddies wildest dreams.\. Lot's of beefcake and such.
Yet, here we have such a cute girl.
Too bad that doesn't really say anything about the player's actual appearance.
Just like in the old days of MMOs.\. Some things never change.

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Bow is just ahead.\. It's a bit of a walk, though.\. Just follow me.

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Go to the bow of the ship.

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Carla, what where all those destructible boxes doing in that room anyway?

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: I was just practicing how to use those things, y'know?

desc: EventTrigger Carla to the front START IF plot.line >= 130

text.en_US: Probably should have done that somewhere else.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 1 START IF plot.line >= 141 && map.standAtFront

text.en_US: Now girl, have a look at this!

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Well, I guess this cleared up some things at least, right?

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Alright then, I think this is a good time to split.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: I'm gonna go to the captain and help him set up that combat lesson for you.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Meanwhile you can have a look around the ship, if ya like.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: The crew knows about ya.\. I guess you already noticed that, right?

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: You can meet me later nearby the captain.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Until then! Just make sure not to drop into the water, girl!

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: By the way, Lea.\. I had a closer look at those speech synchronization issues.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: I'm afraid I don't think I'll be able to fix those issues soon.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: However, I found a little work around.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: I might be able to hard-code specific audio patterns into your speech module.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: ...That means you'll be able to say certain words.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: That should help a bit, correct?

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen
EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: It works! That should help you start some conversations with the crew here.

desc: EventTrigger Rhombus Square View 2 START IF plot.rhombus-seen

text.en_US: Have a look around the ship.
So, ye ready for the battle?
That's what I like to hear! Let's the battle begin!
Well then, tell me when ye are.
Carla!\. Are ye ready up there?
Yes, Cap! Don't forget the goggles!
Haven't been wearin' those for some time...
I was told ye learned the basics down in the cargo hold.
Still, I first want ye to show me your grip on aimin' and throwin'.
Time to say hello to an old friend!
Listen carefully.\. I want ye to hit this robot from this distance ten times.
And do it quickly! Got, that?
Quickly hit the target-bot ten times.
I see, ye understand the basics well enough.
Aye, just as I expected. Ye noticed how half of them balls missed the target?
Ye still need to understand how to aim properly.
Be patient, lass!\. Ye missed your target too often again.
Ye're supposed to quickly throw balls at the target.
Ye're supposed to throw quickly, lass!
No darn charged ball after the other, ye understand?
Should I explain ye the basics, again?
I'll show ye how it's done.\. Watch closely.
See them dotted lines? This is the throwing range.
When I now start throwing them balls, they will be flyin' randomly in between the two lines.
This is some pretty darn sloppy throwin'.\. We won't have that here, ye hear me?
Now fact is, when ye be throwin' balls your precision will improve over time, like this.
Then ye better \c[3]keep the aim\c[0] and \c[3]stop the darn throwin'\c[0]!
Once ye got your lines connected, ye can throw with high precision.
See how ye \c[3]keep your precision\c[0] after throwin'?
Once ye got the lines connected ye can quickly throw as many precise balls as ye want!
But, your precision is lost when you \c[3]change your aiming direction\c[0] too quickly.
So in short: \c[3]Don't ye rush with the throwin'\c[0]!

Ye better get it right this time around, lass.
Good, let's see if ye got the message.
Quickly hit the target-bot ten times.
Your choice.\. Just keep in mind that good aiming is essential for combat.
Carla!\. We need that turret now!
Time to turn on ol' Betty.
Next we will be practicin' the dash.
The turret will now start shooting at you.

First, \c[3]keep your aim\c[0] at the turret but \c[3]don't throw\c[0] anything.
Second, \c[3]dodge\c[0] the bullets of the turret \c[3]without losing your aim\c[0].

text.en_US: Miss Avatar! You totally rocked that crab! This was so awesome!
But that strange blue guy was pretty amazing, too!
Did you see how he just jumped up from the water?
Not to mention how he just dragged you through the air, telepathy style!
I'm sorry to interrupt, but we need you on the bridge!\. Right now!
Something is approaching us and quickly!
Sorry lass, we have to stop here.\. Duty calls.
Carla, ye clean up the balcony first and come to the bridge afterwards.
Girl, I have no idea what's going on here, but it'd be better for you to go inside, too.
What a particular location we have here.
It's a darn cargo ship, ye dobber!
Ye look like someone who jumped right out of CrossWorlds.
This ship is not part of the bloody playground.
So, don't be a nuisance and get lost.
We are aware of the nature of this place.
Yet we perceive the presence of another misplaced individual.
... This is none of your bloody business!
Get off this ship and back to the game ye came from!
Foolish mortal, do you truly believe we will abide to your command?
... Did ye just call me a "mortal", ye nutcase?
Ye better leave right now or I'll be glad to tighten your grip on reality!
You bore us.\. We will choose to no longer converse with the likes of you.
Anyway, our search has already been concluded.
You.\. You do not belong here.\. You need to be removed.
Wait, you seem all too familiar.
Indeed, it might be a mere coincidence!
Oh, but we most definitely have a way to be certain!
I don't even know what to say!
I mean... seriously?\. What's gonna come next?\. Cyborg sea serpents?
This is the best day, man!
In all my years on this ship, this kind of thing never happened.
This spinning motion, one cannot find it twice in this world.
Truly, there is no doubt about it!
When was the last time we have laid eyes upon you?
Yes, you have our utmost interest!\. You will come with us.
Greetings from the Solar Fist, ye pile of instant matter!
What's this? Yer divine powers can't handle a proper explosion?
Okay, lass.\. Ye need to get off this ship.\. Right NOW!
Carla!\. Bring her back to the teleporter as fast as possible.
And tell me, once she has left the ship.
I'll make sure no trace of CrossWorlds will be left on this ship!
Dude...\. I know you're new around here, but really, ya gotta be more relaxed about all this.
What? Just because I was too quick about cleaning duty?
Well, if ya keep this up, \c[5]people will notice\c[0].
Oh hey! You're that avatar girl right?
I was just giving our newbie here a good ol' lesson.
I'v been working here for 6 months!
Ya sure? Before ya know it, ya'll be cleaning da whole deck back to front every day.
Dude...\. I know you're new around here, but really, ya gotta be more relaxed about all this.
What? Just because I was too quick about cleaning duty?
Well, if ya keep this up, people will notice.
Before ya know it, ya'll be cleaning da whole deck back to front every day.

Have fun!

Ok. We'll make it work, somehow.
You... are probably confused about this situation, correct?

Your task is to hit all these robots with VRP.

Kill all the evil robots to leave The Room.
This is just some Test task!
Guys, check out cool message system I came up with!
I'm not even sure what I'm doing here!

Welcome stranger. Good luck with this and remember: Cloudy drink kills frog!
I know you can here me! Where is he?!
So, you keep him here? What the heck are you doing?!
You know that there is no other way...
No, you have to stop using him like this!
I know you can hear me! Where is he?!
Shizuka, I have to ask you to leave.
So, you keep him here? What do you think you are doing?!
Time is running short. We don't have a choice!
So you abduct a dying person and make him work until his last breath? Is that it?!
I will go and talk some sense into him! Don't get in my way!
What do you think you are doing?!
You are in no condition to do this kind of work now!
All you should do is rest...
... Why should I rest when I'm way beyond recovery?
I need to finish this work. It's my final task.
... I told you about the agreement.
I finish this and they will let you go...
I'm so sorry I got you involved with this.
Just promise me...\. that you will...\. get away...
I'm sorry but I can't let you go any further.
You have to do better than that.
You know this is what he wants as well!
Sure, you'd like to think that!
You don't know when to stop, do you?
You can throw as many enemies at me as you like.
The level threshold doesn't exactly work in your favor.
If you interrupt him, all of his hard work will be lost.\. Don't do this!
So?\. It never should have happened in the first place!
So how about it, want to take on the final challenge?
Oh, they added a welcome sign. Very hospitable.
Anyway, this is supposed to be the first dungeon for new players.
It should be feasible for you. Especially after Carla's track on the cargo ship.
Wait, I see a developer note over here.
"Sorry, this dungeon is still incomplete. Expect more content in the next release."
Huh. This is strange. I thought CrossWorlds was released several years ago.
Anyway, there should be at least some puzzles to solve here.
THE TIME FOR REVENGE IS NIGH!
Lea, do you remember the concept of an MMOG?
Well, MMOG stands for "Massively Multiplayer Online Game".
It is a video game that supports a large number of players simultaneously.
Usually, all these player are connected to a virtual environment from all around the world.
Now, CrossWorlds is like an MMOG, just with one striking difference.
The world of this game is not virtual.\. It is real.
All players are remotely connected to this world through special avatars.
These avatars are of physical shape and tightly connected to all 5 senses of the player.
And you, Lea, are currently logged into this game as well.
Oh, me?\. No, I'm not a player.\. I just work here!
In fact, you're the only avatar on this whole ship.
That is right.\. This cargo ship belongs to the maintenance staff of CrossWorlds.
The actual game takes place in the land you see over there - the Playground.
The reason you are here, Lea, is because you are not a regular player.
You have lost your memory and we try to receive it again.
You see, you have been in this game before.
Being logged into this game, there is a chance you might remember your past.
And that's why we'll try to get you into the real Playground soon.
Yeah, in fact you'll be going to this glass palace of a city over there!
That's Rhombus Square. It's where all players start.
Sorry, afraid we can't let ya pass.
Having some trouble moving those boxes.
Did you know that these treasure chests are instanced for each player?
Oh well.. it means I opened this treasure chest myself before.
The content is replicated for each player.
That's cool, right? No more annoying empty chests because some random player reached it before you!
Yeah.... anyway, gotta meet my friends at the entrance.
Heh, you reached this spot. Not bad!
No reason to hold back. Go claim your price!
I wanna go through the market later~
Also wanna bath in that fountain, naked.

If you put water into a fountain...
It becomes the fountain.
You just jumped into the fountain, didn't you?
That's not how you become water, my friend.
You must be girl they told me about!
Yeah, so the developers asked me to help you to get around.
The areas get quite big and since the \c[3]teleport feature\c[0] isn't done yet they thought you could use someone for that.
So \c[3]whenever you find a teleport position I add it as an option\c[0]. Sounds good?
Great! By the by, you can unlock teleport positions by just visiting maps or finding certain spots.
Alright, just hit me up if you changed you mind.
Could I interest is you some cool and delicious ice cream?
Well... unfortunately we are out of stocks right now.
But: if you bring me some \c[3]fresh ice from Bergen Trail\c[0], I could quickly produce new ice cream.
So... could you bring me some \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0]? About \c[3]5\c[0] should suffice.
You find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].\. Just continued to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Do they seriously make you fetch ice from a distant mountain?
What is this, the middle ages?
Oh, that's too bad. Maybe another time!
Hm... it seems you don't have enough \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] yet. I need about \c[3]5 pieces\c[0].
You find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0]. Just continued to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Oh, you brought me the \c[3]Bergen ice\c[0]! Thank you so much!
And here you got your ice cream! Don't eat it all at once, it might make your head hurt!
You know what? They could have declared "Bergen Ice" a speciality.
That would explain why you'd had to go this distance to fetch it.
People still do all kind of elaborate tasks, because it's a speciality, you know?
Well, nevermind. I'm not a game designer.
Ice cream sure sells quickly when the weather is right.
I'm sorry, the northern part is currently under construction.
It will open up to the public with the next content update!
Sorry, northern part is blocked due to constructions.
It will be open with the next update again!
I'm really looking forward to the next content patch.
I heard rumors about a black market!
By the way, does it make sense to call it a "patch"?
I mean it's not just code. They do proper construction work over there.
It's just a habit from old virtual MMOs. Don't overthink it.
Yeah. I'm also still waiting for that kitchen patch.
My sink is broken. Landlord's gotta patch that!
Stop this, you make by brain hurt.
Did you notice this strange device next to the Inn-Keeper?
Yeah, I forgot you joined CrossWorlds a bit later.
In the first release, you had to recharge your balls once you run out of stamina.
There even was an extra gauge for that in the HUD.
Really? Wow, I can't imagine having fun doing that.
That's why they removed it I guess. No one was happy.
But they keep this asset in as a reminder of the old times.
Hello, how can I help you?
Hey there! We now offer the new \c[3]Chef Sandwich\c[0]. You should try it!
Hey, man! You gotta check out our new \c[3]Chef Sandwich\c[0]!

I prefer my good old ordinary sandwiches, really.
We offer high quality equipment made in Rookie Harbor!
New shipments of high quality equipment from \c[3]Bergen\c[0] just came in!
Hey! It's nice here in the shadow, isn't it?

I dunno... he said he'd arrive around this time.
Maybe stuck in Rhombus Square, watching the city from afar... you know how it is...
Yeah... Can't wait to finally enter that place, too!
... Oh well... Ever notice how that tree has fruit?
I heard those are not instant matter but actual fruit!
Now I really wonder how they taste...
Oh well... it's not like you can eat real-life fruit as an avatar.
If you're waiting for somebody, this is the right spot.
Pretty much everyone here is waiting for new players arriving from Cross Central.
... You seem to be a new player, too. So you know what I mean, right?
C'mon, relax. There is still time.
The raid is scheduled in 10 minutes.
Nothing is planned. It's going to be a mess...
Don't be so serious about it. It's supposed to be fun, remember?
All that water... makes you want to jump right into it!
Not sure I'd do that with your amount of amor.
Also, you'd just dissolve and respawn.
Mh... I swear there was an Entrance here...
A painting is a memory that never fades.
Man, there is market literally everywhere in this town.
I know right? The city plaza is filled with market stand!
And there is another market in the northern part, too.
You can find a lot of rare stuff there, I heard.
Nobody told me that CrossWorld is essentially a half-time shopping spree...
... Now I really feel like bashing some hedgehogs.
I'm afraid this resting spot is for one person only.
Go look for another crate. This is mine.
It is I, the \c[3]Hexacast\c[0]. If you seek my guidance, I am greatly knowledgable when it comes to \c[3]element modes\c[0].
Press \i[cold] to switch to \c[3]Cold Mode\c[0] and \i[heat] to switch to \c[3]Heat Mode\c[0].
To return to Neutral Mode, just press the key of the current element \c[3]again\c[0].
You can switch element modes almost at any time.
They will influence the elemental properties of default attacks which may result in more damage for certain foes.
When you use the right element, you'll see a \c[3]yellow arrow\c[0] pointing upwards next to the damage numbers.
But keep in mind that, at this point in time, you won't be able use any of those fabled \c[3]Combat Arts\c[0] while being in any mode but Neutral.
When using an element mode other than Neutral, your \c[3]element load\c[0] will increase.
This happens when you do any action during \c[3]any\c[0] element mode: throwing a ball, doing a slash etc.
It is of no matter if you hit a foe or not.
If you want to know the current level of your element load, pay good attention to your element icon on the upper left corner while making use of an element mode.
This icon will fill up in a \c[3]yellow\c[0] color.
Once it fills up, you will enter an \c[3]elemental overload\c[0], which forces you back to neutral mode and disables the use of any element modes for some time.
If you want to decrease the element load, I strongly advise you to switch back to \c[3]Neutral Mode\c[0] and continue attacking enemies.
Forsooth, hitting enemies in Neutral Mode will make the element load drop much more swiftly.
I hope my lecture was of help.
How do I switch element modes?
I'm the \c[3]Triblader\c[0]. You got questions about \c[3]Combat Arts\c[0]? Then you're at the right address!
You learn Combat Arts by activating the right \c[3]skills\c[0] in the \c[3]circuit menu\c[0].
The Combat Art skills are always the bright, blue and shiny ones with black symbols.
You can learn 4 different types of combat arts: \c[3]Melee Arts\c[0], \c[3]Throwing Arts\c[0], \c[3]Dashing Arts\c[0], and \c[3]Guarding Arts\c[0].
In fact, you will find two \c[3]skills for each type of Combat Art\c[0] and you'll be able to switch between them!
You can learn more about skills from the orange dude next to me.
You can use all combat arts by pressing the \i[special] key.
Depending on what you're doing while pressing \i[special], you perform a different type of Combat Art.
Just pressing \i[special] will perform a \c[3]Melee Art\c[0].
Press \i[special] while \c[3]aiming\c[0] and you will perform a \c[3]Throwing Art\c[0].
Similarly, pressing \i[special] during \c[3]guarding\c[0] will result in a \c[3]Guarding Art\c[0].
Finally, when you press \i[special] at the same time when pressing \i[dash] for a dash, you will perform a \c[3]Dashing Art\c[0].
\c[3]SP\c[0] (Special Points) are those blue stripes you see next to your HP bar.
You gather SP by fighting enemies with \c[3]regular attacks\c[0]. They also regenerate over time up to 50% of their maximum amount.
Using Combat Arts will consume your SP. There's a pretty simple rule: each level 1 Combat Art will consume exactly one SP.
But keep it mind: as soon as you don't have any SP left, you won't be able to perform any Combat Art until you've gathered new SP.
Cool. I reckon you got it all figured out, then!
How do I learn Combat Arts?
How do I perform Combat Arts?
G'day, mate! I'm the \c[3]Pentafist\c[0] professional and I know all about \c[3]skills and the circuit menu\c[0]. Ask away!
First of all, you need to collect \c[3]CP\c[0] (Circuit Points) to learn skills.
You get CP whenever your level increases, so you should already got at least two of them. Go out there and punch some hedgehogs to get more of 'em!
Once you have at least one CP, you may want to press \i[menu] and select \c[3]Circuit\c[0].
Select the central \c[3]Neutral Circuit\c[0], because that's all there is for now.
You'll see a whole bunch'a skills. You're able to activate those by using your CP.
Note that you can only reach skills \c[3]next to already activated skills\c[3].
At the beginning, you can only reach 4 skills close to the center.
I'm sure you'll find the skills you like. Just give it a burl, mate!
Did you see those parts of the circuit where the connection will \c[3]split into two branches\c[0] and then join together again?
Those things are called \c[3]skill branches\c[0], mate.
The downside of skill branches: you can only activate the skills of \c[3]one branch\c[0].
Yes, it is not possible to have the skills of both branches active at the same time.
But that's not necessarily a bad thing! You can \c[3]switch between the two branches\c[0] at any time. It doesn't even cost any CP.
All you need to do is click the skill of the branch next to the activated skill and select \c[3]"Switch"\c[0].
Switching between branches allows you to adapt your skills to match your environment. Survival is all about adaption, mate!
Ok. Come again, whenever you're confused about skills and the like.
Why, hello there. I'm a so-called \c[3]Quadroguard\c[0] and I'm here to explain the \c[3]equipment menu\c[0] to you. Got anything on your mind?
To equip any gear you've collected, just press \i[menu] and select \c[3]Equipment\c[0].

There you can select your equipment for 5 different \c[3]body parts\c[0]:
head, left arm, right arm, torso and legs.
You can select the same equipment for both left and right arm. That means most weapons can be equipped twice.

There are 4 basic stats in CrossWorlds:
\c[3]HP, Attack, Defense, Focus\c[0].
You probably already know about \c[3]HP\c[0]. The more HP you have, the more damage you can take and therefore survive significantly longer during battle.
\c[3]Attack\c[0] increases the damage you inflict with your attacks. Keep in mind that the final damage can vary depending on the type of attack and other factors.
\c[3]Defense\c[0] will reduce received damage and thus protect your precious HP from vanishing too quickly.
\c[3]Focus\c[0] determines how often you will do \c[3]critical hits\c[0] during combat. If your focus is higher than the focus of your enemies, you will do more critical hits.
But keep in mind that your enemies will have the same advantage over you if their focus is higher than yours.
Alright. Just drop by, when you've changed your mind!
How do I change my equipment?
I didn't mention it before but you can also reset your skill tree here or check your stats.
Oh, it's just a little thing the developers thought to be helpful.
You can basically take a look at \c[3]your progress\c[0] in this area.
Or \c[3]reset your skills\c[0]... for a price that is!
Speaking of money, I also set up a little \c[3]shop\c[0] if you are interested in the tasty stuff.
What can I hook you up with?
You sure you wanna reset all your skills?
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
So, you met the other ones huh?
You don't want to run back here every time to see your stats, right?
Wanna take a look at the stats screen, reset your skills or shop a little?
You sure you wanna reset all your skills?
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF true

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF true

desc: EventTrigger Grinding Explanation(2) START IF true
